definition: the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
to block/to be stuck/to be wedged/customs station/a clip/a fastener/a checkpost/Taiwan pr. [ka3]
to stop/to block/(computing) (coll.) slow/(loanword) card/CL:張|张[zhang1],片[pian4]/truck (from "car")/calorie (abbr. for 卡路里[ka3 lu4 li3])/cassette

pinyin: Jie2 xi1 ka3 · Ai4 er3 ba1

sentences.english: Jessica's musical talents range from singing opera to playing the electric guitar.
sentences.chinese: 傑西卡很有音樂天分，從唱歌劇到彈電吉他她都會。

sentences.english: Sometimes when she gets lonely Jessica Alba likes to f*ck the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 有時候當傑西卡寂寞了就和海水乾。

sentences.english: Jessica’s Daddy went back into his bedroom and into his closet.
sentences.chinese: 傑西卡的爸爸回到他的臥室，然後走進他的衣帽間。

sentences.english: Jessica and Michael meet while waiting for a freshman medical check-up[1] at the university hospital.
sentences.chinese: 傑西卡和邁克在大學醫院等待新生體檢的時候遇見。

sentences.english: Jessica was transferred from the warehouse to the accounting office, which was considered a promotion.
sentences.chinese: 傑西卡從倉庫調到了會計室，想來應該算是一種升職。

sentences.english: Jessica, a 42-year-old forensic scientist, is typical of the lucky group.
sentences.chinese: 四十二歲的法醫學家傑西卡是幸運組的典型。

sentences.english: You can ask Jessica what it’s like to be his sister.
sentences.chinese: 你可以問問傑西卡，做喬伊的姐姐是個什麼感覺。

sentences.english: This time, instead of recoiling , Jessika hugged him back.
sentences.chinese: 這一次，傑西卡不再退縮，而是主動回哥哥一個擁抱。

sentences.english: Jessica Alba played a stripper in the movie “Sin City”.
sentences.chinese: 傑西卡阿爾巴在電影《罪惡之城》中扮演脫衣女郎。

sentences.english: Marshall stopped fooling around with other girls when he met Jessica.
sentences.chinese: 自從遇見傑西卡，馬歇爾就不再與其他女孩胡來了。

sentences.english: Jessica even taught her Daddy one of her dances.
sentences.chinese: 傑西卡甚至還教她爸爸跳她經常跳的一種舞蹈。

sentences.english: Then Jessika's father placed her on Mac's back.
sentences.chinese: 而後，傑西卡的父親將她放上馬背。

sentences.english: Jessica later told the police that she was on TV a few weeks ago to see A Sangqi.
sentences.chinese: 傑西卡後來對警方稱，她數週前在電視上看到阿桑奇。

sentences.english: Jessica said. “I can already sense the expansion of the crowd.
sentences.chinese: “對，”傑西卡說，“我已經能察覺出人羣在膨脹。

sentences.english: Please put Jessica email in the distribution list.
sentences.chinese: 請把傑西卡電子郵件通訊組列表中。

sentences.english: One day while visiting Mac, Jessika began singing.
sentences.chinese: 一天，傑西卡來看麥克時，唱起歌來。

definition: to visit a prisoner (usu. a relative or friend)
King Zhou of Shang (11th century BC), notorious as a cruel tyrant
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
Brave New World, novel by Aldous Huxley 阿道司·赫胥黎[A1 dao4 si1 · He4 xu1 li2]
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
